titleStmt.title: Thomas Parker et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10217

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To his Ecellency Beriah McGoffin
Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioners respectfully state a Vacancy has occured in the Seventh Magistrate District Shelby county Kentucky by the death of Henry S Carress and would recommend the Vacancy filled by Robert J. R. Baker who is the only man in the district, will accept the appointment untill the may election and it is nesssary that the Vacancy should be filled immediately, and your petitioners will ever pray & c & c

Petitioners Names
Thomas Parker
John Brown
C. T. Shepherd
Jno. T. Moore
S. B. Whitaker
thomis smithey
Josiah Daniel
J. G. McCormick
J H McCampbell
F. M. Hankins
Petitioners Names
State of Kentucky
Shelby County Sct

Thomas Parker made Oath that the statements in the above petition is true, and that the signatures to said petition is ^the^ Genuine signatures Given under my hand as a Justice of the peace for said County this 9 day of March 1861
O M, Randale J. P. S. C

Shelby Co
To his Ecellency
B. Mcaguffin
Govenor of Ky
Issd Mar. 22. 1861
Robt J. R Baker

Send Commission to Thos Parker
Harrisonville Ky.
